content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #190

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Subscription Request
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: Since the parameters do not directly follow this paragraph, they are not 'following parameters'. Especially since there is a conformance statement between the paragraph and the paramenters.

Existing wording: To create a subscription, the subscribing app performs an HTTP POST (RFC7231) to the Hub's base url (as specified in cast-hub) with the following parameters, authenticating with the Bearer access token.
Proposed wording: To create a subscription, the subscribing app performs an HTTP POST (RFC7231) to the Hub's base url (as specified in cast-hub) with the parameters in the table below, authenticating with the Bearer access token.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #190

isaacvetter commented on Issue #190

Tony,

I don't have a lot of experience with HL7's balloting process. Can you help me understand why it makes sense for this to be a Negative vote?

Isaac

isaacvetter deleted a comment on Issue #190

Tony,

I don't have a lot of experience with HL7's balloting process. Can you help me understand why it makes sense for this to be a Negative vote?

Isaac

ajuliansr commented on Issue #190

Recondidering: To create a subscription, the subscribing app performs SB To create a subscription, the subscribing app SHALL perform

ajuliansr edited a comment on Issue #190

Reconsidering: To create a subscription, the subscribing app performs SB To create a subscription, the subscribing app SHALL perform

isaacvetter commented on Issue #190

Proposed wording: To create a subscription, the subscribing app SHALL perform an HTTP POST (RFC7231) to the Hub's base url (as specified in cast-hub) with the parameters in the table below, authenticating with the Bearer access token.

:+1: Including in block vote.
